class_notes:
CONTENT: Spanish 302W is one of the foundational courses for the major and minor in Spanish. This course has a transatlantic and interdisciplinary approach, and introduces students to the analysis of cultural texts (novel, poetry, art) in Spain and Latin America from the eighteenth century to the present. 
PREREQUISITE: Spanish 212 or Official Placement for a FOUNDATIONAL COURSE (SPAN 300-318W) from the Department of Spanish and Portuguese. Take the exam at http://spanport.emory.edu/home/undergraduate/placement/index.html
course_description: A survey course in Spanish and Spanish American culture from the eighteenth century to the present.
